5th cousin 1 time removed of Michael Tim MAJOVSKY ChartsMy Personal Pedigree Chart

Relationship chart

Théodore Gilbert Ronald Chénier

Théodore Gilbert Ronald CHENIER went by the name of Ron. He, was born on 15 April 1943 at home at 66 Third Ave in Timmins, ON, Canada . He and Linda Vivienne ABBOTT were engaged on 30 October 1968 in Soest, Westphalia, Germany. He married Linda Vivienne ABBOTT, daughter of Frederick John George ABBOTT and Dorothy Betty GOODE, on 25 January 1969 in Blessed Sacrement Church, Leicester, Leicestershire, England, the priest was Julian Rousseau. He and Linda Vivienne ABBOTT were divorced on 23 January 1990 in Ottawa, ON, Canada . He and Maureen FRASER began living together on 31 May 1991 in Nepean, ON, Canada.

Ron was a Supply Technician with the Canadian Army from 1962 to 1985. After his retirement from the Canadian Forces he worked as a Communications Storeman for the Department of Foreign Affairs and International Trade Canada, (DFAIT) in Ottawa from 1985 till his "second" retirement from the Federal Government in March 1998.

FAMILY PHOTO: The Chénier Clan, in Timmions Jun 1976

Claudette Fidélia Chénier

Claudette Fidélia CHENIER, was born on 21 May 1938 at St. Mary's Hospital|à l'hôpital St. Mary in Timmins, ON, Canada .1 She married Dennis William OTHMER, son of Russell Willard OTHMER and Elizabeth (Betty) (Anderson Graham) LAING, on 15 June 1956 in St. Patrick, Cobalt, ON, Canada.2,3 She and Dennis William OTHMER were divorced circa 1980. She married Raymond CAMERON, son of Samuel CAMERON and Euphemia GRANT, on 15 May 1981 in Sudbury, ON, Canada . She died on 6 May 2021 at her residence at the Redwood Apartments in Ottawa, ON, Canada, at the age of 82.

Magella Albert Isidore (Gérard) (Jerry) Chénier

Magella Albert Isidore (Gérard) (Jerry) CHENIER, was born on 23 September 1912 in Hull, QC, Canada ,1,2 and was baptized on 24 September 1912 in Hull, QC , Godparents: Albert Gareau & Constance Chénier.3,2 He received First Holy Communion on 14 June 1925 in St-Hilarion, Cobalt, ON, Canada. He married Violet Ethel SMITH, daughter of Louis SMITH and Délia LEFEBVRE, on 16 August 1937 in Notre-Dame-de-Lourdes, Timmins, ON, Canada.4,1 He died on 3 November 1981 in Windsor, ON, Canada, at the age of 69.5 He was cremated in November 1981 in Windsor, ON.5 Magella was an embalmer, an undertaker, a miner and a store clerk.

Research Notes: In searching Notre-Dame-De-Grace parish records for Hull, Québec at the ANQ in Gatineau the microfilm record clearly indicates his actual name at baptism was: Magella Albert Isidore Chénier.

I have found other records which use Gérard as another one of his names. Where this comes from is unknown. He was also known as Jerry. As a young boy I remember that one of his nick names was also Ti-moine.

FAMILY PHOTO: This is a Chénier family gathering photo for some kind of occasion taken, it is believed at the Chénier house in Chénier, QC in Sep 1948.

#25

Father*Antoni WOZOWCZYK b. circa 1885 Mother*Filomena TURKIEWICZ b. circa 1891

Jan (John) Wozowczyk

Jan (John) WOZOWCZYK, was born on 27 August 1919 in Nowa Huta, Eastern Galicia, Poland .1,2 He married Dorothy Betty GOODE, daughter of Thomas Henry Lewis GOODE and Sarah Ellen BISHOP, on 21 March 1953 in Leicester, Leicestershire, England.3 He died on 14 December 2014 at Benetas St. Pauls Court, in Seaford, Victoria, Australia, at the age of 95.4,1

A Short Biography

Jan Wozowczyk

Born in Poland on 27 August 1919

Passed away on 14 December 2014

Aged 95 years

JAN WOZOWCZYK: 27 AUGUST 1919 – 14 DECEMBER 2014

Jan was born in Nowa Huta, a small village in the then Polish district of Buczacz in Eastern Galicia. Following the Russian invasion of Eastern Poland in 1939, he and most of his family were deported to a labour camp at Winokurka near Swierdlowsk in Siberia in 1940.

In 1942, leaving his family in Siberia, he joined the Anders Army, travelling through the Middle East and Africa to England where he joined the 1st Polish Parachute Brigade. Following training in Scotland, he took part in the Battle of Arnhem where he was taken prisoner, spending time in Stalag XIIA (Limburg) and IVB (Mühlberg).

Following the war Jan settled in Leicester, England where he married Dorothy and raised his family. He and Dorothy emigrated to Melbourne, Australia at the end of 1987 to be near their son, Stefan. He remained proud of his Polish roots and in 2000, 58 years after he last saw his Polish family, Jan returned to Poland and was reunited with his 5 sisters and their families.

Jan and Dorothy celebrated their 60th wedding anniversary in 2013. Jan died peacefully in Melbourne on 14 December, 2014 and is survived by Dorothy and children Linda, Stefan and Patricia.

A gentle and much-loved man who had a truly remarkable life.

Family

Dorothy Betty GOODE b. 19 September 1921, d. 9 January 2015 Children

Stefan Eryk WOZOWCZYK b. 15 December 1953

Patricia Elizabeth WOZOWCZYK b. 5 April 1962

Father*Percy George ABBOTT b. April 1888, d. circa September 1927 Mother*Gertrude Louise HODGKINS b. 1900

Frederick John George Abbott

Frederick John George ABBOTT, was born on 13 November 1921 in Grimsby, Lincolnshire, England.1,2 He married Dorothy Betty GOODE, daughter of Thomas Henry Lewis GOODE and Sarah Ellen BISHOP, on 23 July 1946 in Leicester, Leicestershire, England.3 He married secondly May UPTON in 1950 in Leicester, Leicestershire.4 He died on 7 September 1993 at the Red Cliffs District Hospital in Red Cliffs, Victoria, Australia, at the age of 715,6,7 and was buried on 10 September 1993 at the Lawn Cemetery, Grave B035 in Red Cliffs, Victoria.8,6 Frederick was a motor mechanic.

Family

[S1073] Newspaper Obit/Article: Sunraysia Daily, Thursday, September 9, 1993:

Death Notices [Page 8, Column 1]

ABBOTT, Frederick George John (Fred)—At Red Cliffs District Hospital on September 7, 1993. Late of Centreway, Red Cliffs. Aged 71 years. At rest.

Funeral Notices [Page 8, Column 1]

ABBOTT—The funeral of the late Mr Frederick George John (Fred) Abbott is appointed to leave the Funeral Chapel of E. O. James & Co, cnr San Mateo Avenue and Eleventh Street, Mildura after a service to commence 2pm tomorrow, Friday, September 10, 1993 for the Red Cliffs Lawn Cemetery.

Rhonda Elizabeth Cole

Rhonda Elizabeth COLE, was born on 27 September 1950 in Melbourne, Victoria, Australia.1 She married Stefan Eryk WOZOWCZYK, son of Jan (John) WOZOWCZYK and Dorothy Betty GOODE, on 2 March 1986 in Melbourne, Victoria.
